result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell D Lacourt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 1 day granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Defendant is not to use possess any firearms.
Property inventory item #16 to be seized and destroyed.
Property items #17, 18 and 19 are to be returned to Dennis Lacourt.
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.  Sign Medical Release for Agent.

No violent contact with any family member.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber STAYED-for used at Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell D Lacourt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Russell D Lacourt in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State amends the charge.  Defendant pleads guilty to the amended count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Menden makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Victim makes statements.  All 4 firearms were previously seized.  Item #16 in the Property inventory was the firearm used.  Items # 17,18 and 19 were not used.  
The Court Orders the Following: amended count #1

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
6 months Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 1 day).  
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Conditions of Probation:
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Sign Medical Release for Agent;
No violent contact with any family member.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
Defendant is not to use possess any firearms.
Condition Time: 30 days huber  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion
COSTS:  $ 243.00    to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $200.00  to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Property inventory item #16 is to be seized and destroyed.  Property items #17,18 and 19 are to be returned to Dennis Lacourt.
Request for adjournment filed by plaintiff.
Defendant Russell D Lacourt in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Russell D Lacourt in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Russell D Lacourt in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed according to treatment recommendations.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with any family members.   Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Russell D Lacourt in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
